item.title: If the state cannot govern, violence will
item.description: Bangladesh is facing a crisis that extends far beyond the headlines. The show of violence unfolding in many parts of the country is not simply a failure of security.

item.title: A civilised society cannot allow this
item.description: There is, perhaps, no starker example of discrimination in Bangladesh than the treatment of its Harijan community.

item.description: It is disturbing to note that several notorious criminals have been released from jails since the uprising.

item.title: Full pay, half freedom, complete upheaval
item.description: Apparently, salvation for Bangladeshi women has arrived. Jamaat-e-Islami has declared that, under their rule, women will work five hours a day and still receive a full day's pay. Employers will pay for five, and the government will foot the bill for the remaining three.

item.description: "I've made a solemn commitment to deliver an election that would stand out in terms of voter turnout, participation of new and women voters, global confidence in safety and security, and its festive atmosphere as a celebration of democracy and rule of law." - Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus.
